div.l: This long night ther tides men no reste
But yett na force al shal be for þe beste
For Iohn seide as eủere mot I thryue
Iff þat I may yon wenche wol I swyve
Some esement haþ lawe shapen vs
For Iohn þ̉ere is a lawe þat seiþ þus
That if a man in oo poynt be agreued
That in a noþ̉er he shal be releued
Oure corn̄ is stolen sothli it is no nay
And we han had an ille fit to day
And syn I shal haue noon amendemēnt
Agayn my losse I wol haue esement
Bi goddes soule it shal no noþ̉er be
This Iohn aunswerd Aleyn avise þe
The myller͗e is a p̉erilous man he saide
And if þat he out of his slepe abraide
He might don vs boþe a vilany
Aleyn aunswerd I counte him nouȝt a flie
And vp he rist and by þe wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vpright and fast slepte
Till he so nigh was or she might spie
That it had ben to late for to crie
And shortli for to seyn þei were at oon
Now play Aleyn for I wol spele of Iohn
This Iohn lith stille a forlong weie or twoo
And to him silf he makeþ routhe and woo
Allas ꝙquod he this is a wikke Iape
Now may I seyn þat I is but an ape
Yett haþ my felaw som what for his harme
He haþ þe myllers doughter in his arme
He auntred him and haþ his nedes spedde
And I lie as a draffe sak in my bedde
And whan þis Iape is tolde anoþ̉er da
